maml:description.maml:para: Connects to Citrix Cloud and creates required API headers.

Authenticates against Citrix Cloud using `Client_Id` and `Client_Secret`, resolves the CVAD `Citrix-InstanceId`, and constructs headers for subsequent CTXCloudApi requests. Returns a `CTXAPIHeaderObject` containing `CustomerName`, `TokenExpireAt` (about 1 hour), `CTXAPI` (ids), and `headers`.
Citrix Customer ID (GUID) from the Citrix Cloud console.
OAuth Client ID created under Citrix Cloud API access.
OAuth Client Secret for the above Client ID.
Display name used in reports/filenames to identify this connection.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Citrix Customer ID (GUID) from the Citrix Cloud console.
OAuth Client ID created under Citrix Cloud API access.
OAuth Client Secret for the above Client ID.
Display name used in reports/filenames to identify this connection.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
CTXAPIHeaderObject. Contains authentication headers and context for CTXCloudApi cmdlets.

maml:alert.maml:para: The access token typically expires in ~1 hour. Re-run Connect-CTXAPI to refresh headers when needed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $splat = @{ Customer_Id = "xxx" Client_Id = "xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx" Client_Secret = "yyyyyy==" Customer_Name = 'HomeLab' } $APIHeader = Connect-CTXAPI @splat

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-CTXAPI -Customer_Id "xxx" -Client_Id "xxx-xxx" -Client_Secret "yyyyyy==" -Customer_Name "Prod" Creates and returns a `CTXAPIHeaderObject`. Store it in a variable (e.g., `$APIHeader`) and pass to other cmdlets.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns details about published applications (handles pagination).
Returns details about published applications from Citrix Cloud CVAD.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of application objects returned from the CVAD Manage API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_Application -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object Name, Enabled, NumAssociatedDeliveryGroups Lists application names, enabled state, and associated delivery group count.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_Application -APIHeader $APIHeader | Where-Object Enabled | Select-Object Name Shows only enabled applications.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns details about cloud services and subscription.
Returns details about Citrix Cloud services and subscription state from the `serviceStates` endpoint.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of service state objects returned from the Core Workspaces API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_CloudService -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object serviceName, state, lastUpdated Lists each service name, its current state, and the last update time.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_CloudService -APIHeader $APIHeader | Where-Object { $_.state -ne 'Enabled' } Shows services that are not currently enabled.

maml:description.maml:para: Reports on system config.
Reports on Machine Catalogs, Delivery Groups, Published Applications, and VDI Machines. Collects audit data and either returns it to the host (default) or exports it to Excel/HTML.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and context.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and context.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
When Export is Host: PSCustomObject with properties Machine_Catalogs, Delivery_Groups, Published_Apps, VDI_Devices.
When Export is Excel or HTML: No objects returned; files are written to ReportPath.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigAudit -APIHeader $APIHeader Returns a PSCustomObject containing Machine_Catalogs, Delivery_Groups, Published_Apps, and VDI_Devices.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigAudit -APIHeader $APIHeader -Export Excel -ReportPath C:\Temp Exports an Excel workbook (XD_Audit-<CustomerName>-<yyyy.MM.dd-HH.mm>.xlsx) with sheets for each dataset.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigAudit -APIHeader $APIHeader -Export HTML -ReportPath C:\Temp Generates an HTML report (XD_Audit-<CustomerName>-<yyyy.MM.dd-HH.mm>.html) with tables and branding.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns high-level configuration changes in the last X days.
Returns high-level configuration changes over the past X days from the Config Log Operations endpoint.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Number of days to report on (e.g., 7, 15, 30).
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Number of days to report on (e.g., 7, 15, 30).
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of configuration operation objects returned from the CVAD Manage API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 15 | Select-Object TimeStamp, ObjectType, OperationType, User Shows recent configuration operations with key fields for the past 15 days.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 7 | Where-Object { $_.ObjectType -eq 'DeliveryGroup' } Filters operations related to Delivery Groups in the last 7 days.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a connection report from CVAD Monitor data.
Reports on user session connections for the last X hours.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers (used to fetch Monitor OData).
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers (used to fetch Monitor OData).
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
When Export is Host: array of connection report objects; when Export is Excel/HTML: no output objects and files are written to ReportPath.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConnectionReport -MonitorData $MonitorData -Export HTML -ReportPath c:\temp Generates an HTML report titled "Citrix Sessions" with the full dataset.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConnectionReport -APIHeader $APIHeader -hours 48 -Export Excel -ReportPath c:\temp Fetches 48 hours of Monitor data and exports an Excel workbook (Session_Audit-<yyyy.MM.dd-HH.mm>.xlsx).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ConnectionReport -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object Upn, DnsName, EstablishmentDate, AVG_ICA_RTT Returns objects to the host and selects common fields for quick inspection.

Returns details about Delivery Groups from Citrix Cloud CVAD.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.

Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of delivery group objects returned from the CVAD Manage API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_DeliveryGroup -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object Name, TotalMachines, InMaintenanceMode Lists group name, total machines, and maintenance status.

command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_DeliveryGroup -APIHeader $APIHeader | Where-Object { $_.IsBroken } Shows delivery groups marked as broken.

maml:description.maml:para: Reports on connection or machine failures in the last X hours.
Reports on machine or connection failures in the last X hours using Monitor OData.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Type of failure to report on. Supported values: Connection, Machine.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Type of failure to report on. Supported values: Connection, Machine.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
When Export is Host: array of failure report objects; when Export is Excel/HTML: no output objects and files are written to ReportPath.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_FailureReport -MonitorData $MonitorData -FailureType Connection Returns connection failures to the host.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_FailureReport -APIHeader $APIHeader -FailureType Machine -hours 48 -Export Excel -ReportPath C:\Temp Exports machine failures for the last 48 hours to an Excel workbook.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_FailureReport -APIHeader $APIHeader -FailureType Connection | Select-Object User, DnsName, FailureDate, PowerState Shows common fields for connection failures.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns details about low-level configuration changes (more detailed).

Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Unique id for a config change (from Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog).

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of low-level operation objects returned from the CVAD Manage API.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $ConfigLog = Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 7 $LowLevelOperations = Get-CTXAPI_LowLevelOperation -APIHeader $APIHeader -HighLevelID $ConfigLog[0].id Retrieves low-level operations for the first high-level operation in the past 7 days.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: " | Select-Object OperationType, Property, OldValue, NewValue Shows key fields for each low-level change.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------

maml:description.maml:para: Collect Monitoring OData for other reports.
Collects Citrix Monitor OData entities for a specified time window and returns a composite object used by reporting cmdlets.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Relative time window in hours (e.g., 24, 48). When specified, BeginDate is now and EndDate is now minus LastHours.
One or more OData entity names to include. Default is All.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Start of the time window when specifying an explicit range.
End of the time window when specifying an explicit range.
One or more OData entity names to include. Default is All.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Relative time window in hours (e.g., 24, 48). When specified, BeginDate is now and EndDate is now minus LastHours.
Start of the time window when specifying an explicit range.
End of the time window when specifying an explicit range.
One or more OData entity names to include. Default is All.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Composite PSCustomObject containing Monitor OData entities used by reporting cmdlets.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $MonitorData = Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -LastHours 24 Collects the last 24 hours of Monitor OData and returns a CTXMonitorData object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -BeginDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-2) -EndDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-1) -MonitorDetails Connections,Session Collects data for a specific date range and includes only Connections and Session entities.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -LastHours 48 | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Connections Expands and lists connection records for the past 48 hours.

maml:description.maml:para: Resource utilization in the last X hours.
Reports on resource utilization for VDA machines over the past X hours.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers (used to fetch Monitor OData).
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers (used to fetch Monitor OData).
Pre-fetched CVAD Monitor OData created by Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData. If provided, the cmdlet will not fetch data.
Duration window (in hours) to fetch when retrieving Monitor OData. Default: 24.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for exported files when using Excel or HTML. Defaults to $env:Temp.

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
When Export is Host: array of resource utilization objects; when Export is Excel/HTML: no output objects and files are written to ReportPath.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ResourceUtilization -MonitorData $MonitorData -Export Excel -ReportPath C:\temp\ Exports an Excel workbook (Resources_Audit-<yyyy.MM.dd-HH.mm>.xlsx) with aggregated resource metrics.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ResourceUtilization -APIHeader $APIHeader -hours 48 -Export HTML -ReportPath C:\temp Generates an HTML report titled "Citrix Resources" for the last 48 hours.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_ResourceUtilization -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object DnsName, AVGPercentCpu, AVGUsedMemory, AVGSessionCount Returns objects to the host and selects common fields for quick inspection.

maml:description.maml:para: Calculate VDA uptime and export or return results.
Calculates VDA machine uptime based on registration/deregistration timestamps.
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for the exported report.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.
Destination/output for the report. Supported values: Host, Excel, HTML. Default: Host.
Destination folder for the exported report.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
When Export is Host: array of uptime objects; when Export is Excel/HTML: no output objects and files are written to ReportPath.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_VDAUptime -APIHeader $APIHeader -Export Excel -ReportPath C:\temp\ Exports an Excel workbook (VDAUptime-<yyyy.MM.dd-HH.mm>.xlsx) with uptime details.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_VDAUptime -APIHeader $APIHeader -Export HTML -ReportPath C:\Temp Generates an HTML report titled "Citrix Uptime".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CTXAPI_VDAUptime -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object DnsName, Days, OnlineSince, SummaryState Returns objects to the host and selects common fields for quick inspection.

maml:description.maml:para: Checks that the connection is still valid, and the token hasn't expired.
Checks that the connection is still valid, and the token hasn't expired.
Use Connect-CTXAPI to create headers.
If the token has expired, it will connect and renew the variable.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Use Connect-CTXAPI to create headers.
If the token has expired, it will connect and renew the variable.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Test-CTXAPI_Header -APIHeader $APIHeader -AutoRenew
